content: let $W$ be the set of all vectors of the form shown, where $a$, $b$, and $c$ represent arbitrary real numbers. In each case, either find a set $S$ of vectors that spans $W$ or give an example to show that $W$ is not a vector space. \[ \quad  egin{bmatrix} 3a + b \ 4 \ a - 5b \ \end{bmatrix} \]
Determine if $\mathbf{w} =  egin{bmatrix} 1 \ 3 \ -4 \ \end{bmatrix}$ is in $	ext{Nul }A$, where \[ A =  egin{bmatrix} 3 & -5 & -3 \ 6 & -2 & 0 \ -8 & 4 & 1 \ \end{bmatrix}. \]

For the matrix in this exercise, (a) find $k$ such that $	ext{Nul }A$ is a subspace of $\mathbb{R}^k$, and (b) find $k$ such that $	ext{Col }A$ is a subspace of $\mathbb{R}^k$. \[ \quad A =  egin{bmatrix} 2 & -6 \ -1 & 3 \ -4 & 12 \ 3 & -9 \ \end{bmatrix} \]

In this exercise, find a basis for the space spanned by the given vectors $\mathbf{v}_1, \dots, \mathbf{v}_5$. \[ \quad  egin{bmatrix} 1 \ 0 \ -3 \ 2 \ \end{bmatrix},  egin{bmatrix} 0 \ 1 \ 2 \ -3 \ \end{bmatrix},  egin{bmatrix} -3 \ -4 \ 1 \ 6 \ \end{bmatrix},  egin{bmatrix} 1 \ -3 \ -8 \ 7 \ \end{bmatrix},  egin{bmatrix} 2 \ 1 \ -6 \ 9 \ \end{bmatrix} \]
The set $\mathcal{B} = \{1+t^2, t+t^2, 1+2t+t^2\}$ is a basis for $\mathbb{P}_2$. Find the coordinate vector of $p(t) = 1 + 4t + 7t^2$ relative to $\mathcal{B}$.

Determine the dimensions of $	ext{Nul }A$ and $	ext{Col }A$ for the matrices shown in this exercise. \[ \quad A =  egin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 & -4 & 2 & -1 & 6 \ 0 & 0 & 1 & -3 & 7 & 0 \ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 & 4 & -3 \ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \ \end{bmatrix} \]

Let $p_1(t) = 1 + t^2$, $p_2(t) = t - 3t^2$, $p_3(t) = 1 + t - 3t^2$. Consider the basis $\mathcal{B} = \{p_1, p_2, p_3\}$ for $\mathbb{P}_2$. Find $q$ in $\mathbb{P}_2$, given that \[ [q]_{\mathcal{B}} =  egin{bmatrix} -1 \ 1 \ 2 \ \end{bmatrix}. \]

The first four Hermite polynomials are $1$, $2t$, $-2 + 4t^2$, and $-12t + 8t^3$. These polynomials arise naturally in the study of certain important differential equations in mathematical physics. \ 
ewline Let $\mathcal{B}$ be the basis of $\mathbb{P}_3$ consisting of the Hermite polynomials mentioned above, and let $p(t) = 7 - 12t - 8t^2 + 12t^3$. Find the coordinate vector of $p$ relative to $\mathcal{B}$.
Let $\mathbf{u} =  egin{bmatrix} 1 \ 2 \end{bmatrix}$. Find $\mathbf{v}$ in $\mathbb{R}^3$ such that \[  egin{bmatrix} 1 & -3 & 4 \ 2 & -6 & 8 \ \end{bmatrix} = \mathbf{u}\mathbf{v}^T. \]

In $\mathbb{P}_2$, find the change-of-coordinates matrix from the basis $\mathcal{B} = \{1 - 3t^2, 2 + t - 5t^2, 1 + 2t\}$ to the standard basis. Then write $t^2$ as a linear combination of the polynomials in $\mathcal{B}$.
